Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as no specific company is identified in the message, and no announcements were found on the websites of larger baby formula brands regarding obtaining formula through calling a number on the back of the product.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that parents can receive a case of baby formula by calling the number on the back of a product during the COVID-19 pandemic, which is not supported by evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no company or organization is providing free formula through this method, as confirmed by Aptamil Customer Services and a spokesperson for the company.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the ease with which parents can obtain a case of baby formula by simply calling a number on the back of a product, which is not true.
